newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian gold ends higher, silver trims early losses.
newsitem.headline: Indian gold ends higher, silver trims early losses.

text.p: Indian gold prices firmed up towards close on Monday on thin supplies, recouping early losses, dealers said.
They said demand was poor and volumes low on Monday. Prices of gold biscuits (116.50 gms) ended Rs 100 higher at Rs 58,700 per piece.
Stray industrial buying trimmed early losses in silver which opened lower on arrivals of about 500/700 Kg of imports, dealers said. Silver was up by Rs 50 per Kg during last week.
Sentiment was subdued at close and traders said they expected the market to be range-bound in the immediate future.
